text: Shahzada Mirza Muhammad Quaish Shikoh BAIG (1820 – c. 1889) also known as Mirza Quaish Shikoh (Muhammed Baig) was a son of Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah II and Moti Bai. After the Indian Mutiny 1857-58, He came to udaipur where the Maharana of Mewar granted him a small subsistence pension. After that he had an son named Shahzada Mirza Abdullah Baig, who married the daughter of chief Qazi (islamic judge) of Amrabad province (Maryam Begum). They had a son, Mirza Muhammed Jaffer Baig who moved to Hyderabad State and his descendants still live in Hyderabad. ==References== Category:1820 births Category:1889 deaths Category:Mughal princes
title: Mirza Quraish Shikoh
